basics.name: Dominic Fischer
basics.label: Master's student at University of Zurich (UZH)

work.name: Institute of Computational Linguistics, University of Zurich
work.summary: I worked with LLMs via APIs in the context of analysing, processing and experimenting with the large XML-corpus of Swiss Reformator Heinrich Bullinger's Letter collection. I...

work.name: Institute of Computational Linguistics, University of Zurich
work.position: Tutor of Introdcution to Computational Linguistics I & II
work.summary: I tutored the mandatory Bachelor's courses 'Introduction to Computational Linguistics I & II' twice each in four consecutive semesters. I...

highlights.prefix: prepared and visualised learning materials for students.
held (bi-)weekly tutorials presenting the materials, providing assistance and fostering connection between students.
created and graded exercises and provided constructive feedback.

work.name: Institute of Informatics, University of Zurich
work.summary: I tutored the mandatory Informatics Bachelor's course 'Database Systems'. I...

highlights.prefix: solved aloud and explained the weekly assignments in class.
answered questions regarding the assignments and the course on the online course platform.
held office hours for students to provide additional assistance.

work.name: Impuls Nachhilfezentrum
work.summary: I tutored kids, adolescents and adults primarily in Mathematics, but also in German and, sporadically, other subjects. I...

highlights.prefix: helped them keep up with their day-to-day school materials.
prepared them for major exams such as the entrance exams for high school (Gymi-Aufnahmeprüfung) or for the University of Teacher Education (Pädagogische Hochschule (PH) Zürich)
motivated them to develop a positive attitude towards school and taught them how to study effectively and efficiently.

work.name: Tennisclub Volketswil
work.summary: I coached youth aged five to fifteen to develop technically sound tennis skills and find joy in tennis and sports in general. I...

highlights.prefix: took a J+S (Jugend + Sport) youth tennis trainer course in order to have a foundational coaching education.
devised and implemented age-appropriate training programs to foster developmen.
motivated the younger ones and helped them develop their motor skills while sharpening the technique of the ones that had overcome that first hurdle.

organised and oversaw the youth tennis season as a youth coordinator on the executive board in 2021/2022,  including managing sign-ups, forming training groups, and serving as a point of contact for parents.

volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine

publications.name: To the Publications Section
publications.summary: My publications, available on the publications page, center around the capabilities and limitations of large language models (LLMs) in the context of historical text corpora, particularly focusing on the letter collection of Swiss Reformer Heinrich Bullinger.

projects.name: To the Projects Section
projects.summary: A particular foucs of my projects, available on the projects page, is and has been language learning. Be it through creating and making language learning materials available, developing tools or games to facilitate language learning, I am passionate about all things related to language learning.
